title: Japanese apparel firms give new life to their old clothes
summary: Firms in Japan's fashion industry are increasingly reselling used clothes to reduce waste. Sanyo Shokai has started selling secondhand apparel collected from customers in exchange for coupons, ensuring quality through inspection. Uniqlo is also entering the secondhand market by recycling materials and reselling used clothes at lower prices or after re-dyeing them. These efforts reflect a commitment to resource reuse.
